adjectives.description: millenarian (comparative more millenarian, superlative most millenarian)

entries.meaning: (Christianity) Pertaining to the belief in an impending period of one thousand years of peace and righteousness associated with the Second Coming of Christ. [from 17th c.]
examples: Franciscans coming from Iberia were particularly prone to the millenarian enthusiasm which gripped southern Europe around 1500, and which the Franciscan Order had so long fostered. They believed that they were living in the End Times [...].

entries.meaning: Pertaining to any of various religious or social movements which believe in a coming radical change to existing world order. [from 20th c.]
Lasting or expected to last a thousand years.
examples: […]  contrasts with the rapid decline and demise of the millenarian empire of Byzantium.

entries.meaning: A person who believes in an apocalyptic millennium.
